intro: Hibbertia nemorosa, commonly known as the slender hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Hibbertia nemorosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and unique floral display.
